intro: Humularia welwitschii var. gossweileri, commonly known as the Gossweiler's humularia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers in shades of red and orange. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
